title: It is great working here
pros: The leadership group is well organized. It is worth to learn and growing here.
cons: I have not found any cons so far.

title: Not Worth It
pros: Good Work Life Balance Most are friendly
cons: They don't know what they are doing. They worry about keeping things private even amongst employee They have restrictive practices in Technology, which even hinders one's work and many have said they don't have access to basic things required for their daily work. So, people have started cutting corners in how they work and what they do. Not much time before this starts becoming visible in their earnings too.

title: Work life balance
pros: A company with high growth potential and chance for development
cons: Long hours often resulting in working weekends. Low work/life balance.

title: Toxic Environment and Limited Career Advancement
pros: The company offers a solid benefits package that promotes a healthy work-life balance. Leadership within my department and across the company values grit and initiative, recognizing those who go above and beyond. Executives are committed to the long-term success of the company and focus on sustainable growth. However, opportunities to collaborate with others are limited, and while there is a strong sense of inclusivity when discussing the company’s future, the lack of clear advancement paths and middle management improvements hinder the overall culture.
cons: Unfortunately, I experienced second-class treatment under my manager. Despite my hard work, I was often sidelined with fewer opportunities for advancement and recognition compared to those in favor with management. The culture encouraged snitching, which, combined with favoritism, fostered a toxic work environment. Those who aligned with management were rewarded, leaving others feeling unsupported. The uneven workload, lack of transparency, and poor communication created an atmosphere of disrespect and disillusionment, making me feel undervalued and isolated.

title: Pros and Cons
pros: 1. Excellent benefits & perks Employees consistently praise Welltower’s comprehensive benefits, including health coverage, PTO, wellness programs, and even pet benefits. 2. Smart, challenging environment Many highlight the opportunity to work alongside intelligent, driven colleagues on high-impact projects that offer visibility and growth indeed. 3. Strong organizational reputation As an S&P 500 healthcare-REIT with investment-grade credit ratings (BBB+, Baa1), Welltower offers stability, access to large-scale capital projects, and a respected position in the market Welltower Inc. 4. Development opportunities Interns report structured learning, mentorship, and weekly training sessions helpful for early career development.
cons: 1. Management inconsistency Reviews indicate variability in leadership quality across teams and regions. Complaints include limited transparency, favoritism, and micromanagement . 2. High workload and pace Welltower’s fast-paced, demanding culture can lead to long hours, stress, and work-life balance challenges—often with little recognition

title: Yardi is an Innovative product, Welltower is a strategic organization
pros: 1. Welltower's culture is to support its employees 2. Leadership values it's culture and works with employees to ensure there is job satisfaction and retention across the teams 3. Career opportunities are strong with designated pathways to grow 4. The Yardi product being deployed for properties is a huge game changer for front end and back end property operations 5. Welltower's approach to property management through leveraging this product is 6. Welltower provides sufficient information in the job requirements, the goals to be met in the position, and the autonomy to have your work style to reach them. 7. Diversity is valued here
cons: Not applicable, currently the company is in a state of growth. No cons, the opportunity to develop would be challenging for each department, but growth isn't a bad thing.

title: Great Company
pros: The company has great benefits with an amazing team. Everyone is supportive and really want to see you succeed.
cons: I do not have any cons.

title: Strong company and culture
pros: - Very strong performing culture - Ability to take on new tasks/initiatives - Very smart CEO and management team
cons: - Very top down management - Can be heavy hours during busy periods

title: Great Company
pros: Pay is great; people are great
cons: They treat their employees good and expect them to work hard, which seems fair to me.

title: Good Company and care about employees
pros: Growing, opportunities, kind people, fun work product
cons: Disorganized, care about the bottom line a lot, not as detailed

title: Great

cons: There are no offices or separate cubicles, it is an open environment

title: Good Company

cons: New processes needed Sometimes need long hour

title: Welltower
pros: Great benefits and bonus percentage is great overall.
cons: Alot of traveling. Long hours process changes.

title: Visionaries
pros: Fast paced Remarkable professionals High standards Supportive teams Growth opportunities
cons: Multiple reporting platforms Communication LOB silos

title: Pass

cons: - toxic flat organization that does not allow for material advancement

title: Great Company
pros: Great working environment Great teams overall Incredible benefits Fast growing company
cons: Growing pains due to fast growth Lack of individual development Lack of promotional ability

title: Toxic Office & Environment
pros: The direct deposit is decent. Employee stock purchase plan
cons: Bad manager Bad higher level leadership Yells at employees References rude & inappropriate things during work In office environment is terrible severance type environment

title: Organization of dysfunction and toxcicity
pros: Decent healthcare plan Employee Stock plan
cons: Working in this organization was a deeply disappointing experience, marred by a complete lack of rationality and logical thinking within the decision-making process. The workplace culture is characterized by an alarming tendency to ignore expertise and embrace reactionary decision-making, leaving employees feeling undervalued and unsupported. One of the most glaring issues is the blatant disregard for the valuable insights provided by department managers. Some senior leaders consistently sideline their expertise, opting instead to heed decisions made by a select group of individuals who lack any relevant experience in the areas they are making decisions. This approach not only undermines the expertise of dedicated professionals but also leads to misguided choices that harm the organization in the long run. Promotions and significant raises, crucial aspects of career growth, are only awarded in select departments, and are not necessarily based on merit or skills, but on the basis of cronyism and favoritism. This nepotistic approach not only demoralizes employees who work hard and demonstrate exceptional skills but also fosters a toxic work environment where office politics reign supreme. Genuine talent is systematically ignored, leaving employees feeling insignificant and undervalued. Another alarming aspect of the workplace environment is the tendency to make sweeping cuts without fully understanding the ramifications. Impulsive cost-cutting measures are implemented without a comprehensive analysis, leading to decreased employee morale, increased workload, and overall dissatisfaction. These decisions have a domino effect on productivity and employee well-being, ultimately affecting the organization's overall performance. In conclusion, this workplace is a prime example of an organization where rationality, logic, and fair decision-making are sacrificed at the altar of favoritism, cronyism, and short-sightedness. Many employees are left disheartened and demoralized, leading to a toxic work environment that stifles creativity, innovation, and genuine professional growth.

title: Healthcare Reit
pros: wfh life balance if far enough away from building
cons: It’s a pretty chaotic there.

title: Great Colleagues/Intense Workload
pros:

Lots of vacation
Remote work
cons:
Shared assistants
Run lean on hiring creating frequent burnout

title: Review for welltower
pros: Good benefit, insurance options, and bonus
cons: Lack of transparency, experience varies based on which team you are in

title: Good
pros: Flexible working enviornment with good managers
cons: Corporate Jargon can disorient business direction

title: Great Company To Work For
pros: Great benefits and the people are nice.
cons: None to list at this time.

title: Decent place to work
pros: They offered great benefits, the opportunity to travel, the facility was nice with a gym and cafe.
cons: Management changes over the years affected the culture quite a bit.

title: The paycheck shows up on time
pros: I have a very supportive manager.
cons: Accounting team is much too small. As a result, property management takes on a lot of reviewing for Accounting. Also too much unnecessary middle management and inefficient communication processes.

title: Great company
pros: Great environment to learn and grow your career
cons: can be intense at times

title: Average Company
pros: Flexible work schedule & good pay
cons: There is a good ole boys mentality, not very professional

title: Not what I expected
pros: Flexible, great benefits, great bonus.
cons: Not enough communication from leadership. I have been in companies during transitions and by far the transition within this company has been far from smooth. Corporate pushing out new systems and programs prior to it being fully ready then retracting, and pushing out again to find more issues and so forth. Always being told to check P&P, however, No clear procedures even on website where employees are to go and find Policies & Procedures and a lot information is outdated. This makes it more challenging for newcomers. Be ready to do plenty of self research and more research to find answers. Lack of communication between departments. Very clique and favoritism is noticed. Negative comments about other co workers and past co workers from managers frequently. Certain departments get more leeway on deadlines while other are expected to always meet it. Almost no work/life balance. More cons, but these are the more significant ones.

title: Great Company
pros: Benefits, Pay, welcoming environment, diverse culture. Everyone I’ve ever encountered was pleasant and willing to help if needed.
cons: The customer service dept is not work from home but the other employees are hybrid.

title: Great place to work
pros: Great Company to work for if you want to grow your career and learn
cons: It can be fast paced at times, which can be overwhelming to some

title: Great place to work
pros:
Flexibility 
Transparency 
Variety of work
The people
cons: Promotion process is not straightforward

title: Not as good as it used to be
pros: Great benefits such as generous PTO including time for senior care, 14 paid holidays, 5% 401K matching, excellent health insurance at low premiums, annual bonuses, employee stock purchase program, health incentive programs including gym cost reimbursement, great coworkers and managers.
cons: Increased top down control on local processes, less connection and contact with tenants than we used to have, more bureaucracy, poorer organization and training. They are re-tooling the whole company to be more robotic, centralized and jerking around long term, loyal employees the whole way. Company culture is moving toward a more wokist-progressive mindset and they jump on every corporate bandwagon out there right now. Wage increases are not keeping pace with workload increases.

title: Fantastic workplace
pros: - good culture that emphasizes employee well-being and development - top institutional investment firm that provides cool insights into RE
cons: - can sometimes be a little slow or boring - Pay could be better

title: Horrible work experience
pros: none. no pros horrible work environment
cons: Everything! Benefits are so expensive. The management is toxic. Mico managers. Pay is crap. DONT WORK HERE

title: Tax Intern in Toledo
pros: It's pretty easy going for an intern, but the work runs out quickly.
cons: In the tax department, a lot of your coworkers will not introduce themselves to you. Talking doesn't seem to be a thing.

title: Dark cloud overhead, bad culture
pros: Benefits Pay People (not leaders) 401K Stock purchase
cons: Culture CEO Lack of trust Not enough help No work life balance

title: Karma - Enjoy NY, Tom.
pros: Unfortunately at this time the company has absolutely nothing going for it. On the outside it can look and feel glamorous but it's the complete opposite.
cons: Day one Tom DeRosa came into the company telling everyone how down to earth he was, that he was an employee advocate and so much more. Nothing could be farther from the truth. Tom has been anti-Toledo since day one. The University of Toledo was never good enough to hire graduates or interns from. All new employees should live in Ann Arbor because Toledo wasn't good enough for people of his caliber. As a proud graduate of the University of Toledo that was all so disappointing. Tom has finally gotten his way. He looks like the hero donating the building and property to the University of Toledo but in reality it was only done to get his way and that is out of Toledo. Management continued to lie to employees that the building they were constructing in NY was not meant for a new headquarters. While it may not be the headquarters now, Tom will be working out of that office. Mark my word, eventually the headquarters will be in NY and the hardworking employees that have held it out during the chaotic and stressful times will no longer have a job. To the current employees, don't be afraid to move on. While people say the grass isn't always greener on the other side, I can promise you that this time it will be.

title: Epic Fail
pros: It pays the bills. The corporate HQ was nice when Welltower owned it. The temperature in the building isn't too bad.
cons: This organization went from stellar to rock bottom in 12 months. Without ever addressing its new "course of action" with its employees, Welltower did a complete 180 and terminated about 30% of its workforce. It became a completely strange and confusing environment. Sadly, many important tasks aren't being completed due to the lack of staff. Current management is so focused on cutting compensation that they're not addressing the real struggles within the organization. Recently, Welltower donated its 100 acre Dorr Street (Toledo) campus to The University of Toledo. Nice save. The perfect opportunity to contradict all of the negative reviews that claim that the CEO doesn't live in Toledo nor does he care about the community. That job is done. This left the Toledo (Corporate HQ) based employees wondering what this means for their future in the company. Why would a real estate company give away a $30M piece of real estate if they plan to grow their HQ in Toledo? They don't. It's a slow kill, and it seems like this company is phasing its way out of the Toledo community. This will leave so many good, hard-working employees devastated. As for Welltower's claims that they are in the utmost compliance with regard to employee ethics, managers were instructed to grant nothing higher than a 3 rating on their reports' annual performance reviews. That means that Welltower has no intention of paying their employees based on performance. It's just a lure. What is ironic, is that Welltower only has a 2.6 rating on Glass Door. That's karma for you.

title: Great Company - Great Benefits
pros: - People are great to work wit
cons: - Transparency of short term incentives to reach long term goals

title: Life at welltower
pros: The work freedom is amazing. No over bearing boss breathing down your back.
cons: No room for mistakes and too serious.

title: Great place
pros: Honestly it's incredible. Cafeteria, super cool company, great people
cons: Sometimes feels a bit lost and the organization is a bit top heavy.

title: Great company
pros: Treat employees well and rewarding.
cons: Big learning curve for a complex business model.

title: Poison in the Well
pros: The cafe is pretty nice...
cons: I was initially positive about the prospect of change under the new executive management, headed by DeRosa and Mitra. Unfortunately, they have ham-fisted change management, and have squandered an opportunity to elevate the company to a more sustainable and long-term path to growth. Indiscriminately firing employees and falsely labeling the terminations as “for performance,” they have focused simply on head counts and cost-cutting for what can only be viewed as a setup for the company to be a take-over target by private equity, or some other buy-out of the current shareholders. Employees are scared and cringing, when they should have been empowered and impassioned. DeRosa has failed to impress with his leadership, and one can only surmise that the clock is ticking on the remaining 2 ½ years of his current contract to complete the deal. The duo of DeRosa and Mitra is about the most unlikely pairing one can imagine, and it’s likely they were dropped into place by much larger external players to grease the skids. Make no mistake, the employees are being fed a false bill of goods when they are told that the remaining “lucky” ones are in for some wonderful financial reward. The light they are told to look at is not the end of the tunnel, it’s another train.

title: Great company
pros: Lots of growth opportunity and creative liberty
cons: Minimal on-boarding training or guidance

title: Quality Company in a Promising Industry
pros: The corporate headquarters is located on a beautiful campus in Toledo, OH. Employees are spoiled with a full time chef and kitchen staff, a plethora of development opportunities, and an excellent wellness program to coincide with the on-campus workout facility. A friendly culture exists which promotes collaboration among Welltower's bright employees.
cons: Most of the positions require long hours at least at some points during the year. It can be a bit overwhelming because so many ideas and initiatives are flying around. From a career advancement standpoint, sometimes having the right persona or being liked by the right people is rewarded over productivity.

title: Decent experience, poor transparency and communication
pros: On paper, largest healthcare REIT, lots of interesting investments. Great people on the internal data/business insights team. National and oversees presence with a good outlook on the healthcare real estate industry. Great place to learn a ton about the industry.
cons: Most of the cons of working at a large company apply here. Lack of oversight/initiative from management can silo individuals at the bottom and prevent further growth and development. Top-down communication flow is quite poor; status/position within the firm matters in terms of who has a voice and who is listened to. Lack of recognition from upper management can lower morale at the bottom. Office politics seems to be a big deal here. HR team: Inconsistency and lack of transparency regarding performance evaluation makes it difficult to know what needs to be improved, requires a lot of reading between the lines which can be difficult. Lack of genuine interaction, feel on the fringes and pressured to engage in small talk. Many blanket statements made that seem to look to appease certain employees.

title: Good
pros: Flexible work schedule and good pay
cons: Non-transparent communication from leadership to lower level employees

title: Was a great place
pros: Benefits and environment. Location of offices
cons: It’s changed a lot. Things have seemingly gotten worse. And it’s definitely started from the top

title: Welltower is what you make of it
pros: Enormous opportunity for ambitious professionals who are willing to learn, ask questions, and yes..definitely put in the time. The extremely flat organizational hierarchy provides high visibility and growth potential. Good compensation and benefits
cons: Sad to see the Toledo office transition and many of the perks changing. More and more positions being hired in NY is certainly unnerving, however with recent G&A expense reductions in 2017 and 2018, moving the remaining employees at the Toledo office would be counter-intuitive and grossly expensive.

title: Grass Goes Uncut While the Executives Fly on Their Private Plane
pros: Once a Pillar of the Toledo community.
cons: I use to be proud to say I worked at Welltower. Now I am proud to not be associated with this company. Management has done more than destroy morale. They have destroyed a competent workforce. I speculate this was by designed. I assume it is cheaper to have people quit than fire them. They even have stopped cutting the grass at their once beautiful campus to supposedly cut cost. Meanwhile the executives fly on their private plane and the CEO is paid outlandishly (in my opinion). Other fun tidbits: Welltower has a market capitalization of approximately $25 billion as of September 10, 2018. Per salary.com: “As Chief Executive Officer at WELLTOWER INC, Thomas J. DeRosa made $10,518,064 in total compensation. Of this total $985,801 was received as a salary, $2,197,563 was received as a bonus, $0 was received in stock options, $7,250,000 was awarded as stock and $84,700 came from other types of compensation. This information is according to proxy statements filed for the 2017 fiscal year.”

title: Poor management
pros: They have great benefits, salary and PTO package. The main corporate office in Toledo is beautiful which has a gym and cafeteria. Their office in Florida is very stylish which includes a gym. They also offer gym reimbursement.
cons: As mentioned in other reviews, atmosphere is very cliquey. It's all in who you know not what you know. If you have the luck of getting in the right people's good graces you will do good in this company. There are a handful of great people working there, but if you're not part of a clique you will feel isolated. Many occasions of being excluded from work or social gatherings. Some management leaders live in different states from their employees and are either too busy or just do not care. Weeks and months would go by without one word from the boss. Some employees skills were underutilized and ultimately they paid the price for bad management and were let go for "bad performance".

title: Property Administrator
pros: Pay, Bonus opportunities, Employee perks- volunteer work to assist our communities, fitbit challenges with prizes, annual employee appreciation events.
cons: I loved working at Welltower, each day was different; challenging and a learning opportunity. As time passed, the job became more difficult due to overwhelming staff cuts, workloads increased, morale was down, job loss was imminent. Employee concerns were brushed to the side by Sr. mgmt. with only one goal in mind - the end game for shareholders. Your hard work ethic is of little concern here, it is all about who you know, as to how you are valued in this company.

title: A league of its own
pros: Pros and cons are a matter of perspective. Through past experiences, I had come to expect very little from my employers. You came to work, did a job, and went home--it was transactional. That was the norm. To expect anything more was unrealistic. There were occasional employee appreciation events, but they felt more like gimmicks than gratitude. The culture reflected that mindset, and as a result, I felt very little connection to former employers. In comparison, Welltower is in a league of its own. I view my job as an extension of myself and genuinely look forward to coming to work every day. Describing the environment is difficult. It is competitive yet collaborative. It is a place where you can make an impression, regardless of your title. It is supportive and conducive to learning and professional/personal growth. Above all else, it is a place that is amazing because of the people you suit up and work with every day. Welltower has forever changed my perception of what the "work experience" can be. I'm proud and grateful for the opportunity to work here, and encourage anyone interested in the healthcare, real estate, or finance industries to check it out. Or, if you are like I was, and are just looking for more meaningful work.
cons: Welltower is one of the flattest organizations I have ever worked for. In one hand, the culture provides opportunities that more siloed and compartmentalized companies could never match--things like challenging work, cross-functional projects, and development opportunities. On the other hand, it's an environment that can be stressful and overwhelming if you let yourself get consumed by the over-abundance of work. It is what you make it.

title: Do Your Research
pros: Medical, dental and vision benefits, plus matching 401K. Yearly bonus.
cons: Under constant fear of being let go no matter if you do a good job or not. No consistency on how things are done in each region. Favoritism ABOUNDS in this company. Low pay for the amount of work that is thrust upon you and constant short deadlines.

title: Great Benefits
pros: They have tried everything to recruit the best candidates by offering competitive benefits and bonus packages. Hard work is recognized.
cons: Changing culture is tough, and it doesn’t happen overnight. The executive team doesn’t seem to have the same vision, not on the same page. The company doesn’t have the infrastructure in place to streamline, automate and become more efficient. They continue to acquire complicated deal structures which makes it nearly impossible to develop consistent policies and procedures.

title: Finance Analyst
pros: Unbelievably flat organization - you have access to senior leadership on a daily basis. Even young analysts like myself have pivotal responsibilities that impact performance. The campus in Toledo is beautiful and includes a gym. The employees for the mot part are very down to earth and willing to do things outside of the office. The rotational and internship programs are the premier programs. These lucky analysts get priceless exposure to nearly every segment of the business. There are also employees all over the country which helps from a networking standpoint.
cons: Sometimes the workload can be a bit difficult to handle. However, if you are working under the right manager, you will be thanked appropriately.

title: Accounting
pros: Sad to say but there are are no pros at this time.
cons: This company is going downhill fast! Management does not seem to have the interest of their employees at hand. They will quickly throw you under the bus to save their own tail and some individuals in management were not equipped to take on the role of manager. HR did not seem to be of any assistance so employees must either sink or swim. Ever since Tom took on the CEO position this company began to plummet--employee morale went down along with so many other things. Their donation to the University of Toledo is just a ploy to slowly fade the HQ office from Toledo. Nice try, but most employees and ex-employees know what you are doing—New York here comes Welltower!

title: The Money Isn’t Worth It! Don’t Leave Your Job to Come Here!!
pros: The benefits are good, most people are friendly (the ones that talk to you), always something to do so the work week goes by rather fast.
cons: The feeling of job security is nonexistent for most people I talk with, everyone feels overwhelmed, overworked and under appreciated. Many employees are actively seeking other employment due to all of the above. The company that was once a place of pride has quickly lost its appeal. The only reason at this point many employees stay is because of the pay/benefits and even that isn’t enough anymore to keep the experienced employees.

title: Culture shift needed
pros: During my tenure at Welltower the benefits offered were amazing. Compared to the majority of companies who were forced to increase health insurance premiums while reducing coverage, Welltower offered their employees multiple choices for insurance coverage at an affordable out of pocket expense. Teams drastically differ and if you are lucky enough to align with a team whose members aren’t power hungry (few and far between) and want to foster a sense of team you can certainly gain a lot of knowledge.
cons: This is a truly toxic work environment and the corporate culture leaves something to be desired. The corporate office is cut throat and I could count on one hand the amount of genuine people I ran into when working there. New employees should not expect to feel welcomed. You will have to go out of your way to become part of your team only have people treat you as though you don’t even belong in the same room as them. As stated in a previous comment it is true that you will go days without anyone stopping by your desk. While there are good people at Welltower the entitlement exuded from some people in this office make those "good" people stick to themselves. If you do not align yourself with the right people from day one this place will be very isolating. Don’t mention any issues about this to HR, they will twist everything to being your fault and will not advocate for you at all. As the saying goes “No good deed goes unpunished” do not offer to go above and beyond or make a simple offer to assist because it will be taken the wrong way. An innocent offer to help will be viewed as as a threat and/or seen as an attempt to make someone look bad. Even your own self-deprecating comments meant to make someone feel good about themselves is taken the wrong way. Unfortunately people you will work with here are so insecure about their own position and what will happen to their jobs you are best to keep your head down until you can find a way out. Skills are undervalued and underutilized regardless of your position, who you know and where you got your degree from means more than your work history. If you show interest in a different department or to learn more in an area do not expect anyone to want to give you any work or mentor you even if this benefits the company. It was very clear to me that people some who work here even those who had a long tenure with company were insecure about their positions and this fear for your job mentality infiltrated down from the highest paid employee to the lowest paid employee.

title: Not a Comfortable Environment, but Great Experience Gained
pros: Welltower has a beautiful campus and building. The café food and employees were wonderful. The fast-paced workload was ideal and kept me driven and focused. I enjoyed the various duties that went along with my job, and the large amount of knowledge I gained at Welltower. The bonuses were substantial and the compensation was fair.
cons: Communication by management to employees was poor. There seemed to be a lack of accountability by upper management when it came to addressing issues upfront. Resources for help or assistance were scarce causing a high amount of stress in the work environment.

title: What about Toledo?
pros: Ideal location in Toledo with good food and a pretty campus that also has a good compensation for the general area.
cons: This place was once a great place to work with a deep rooted sense of community, values long term sustainability and a sense of obligation to employees. Under the current management it has totally flipped where they only care about driving earnings growth and serving faceless shareholders at the expense of hardworking employees who have been left behind in favor of cost cutting measures and elimination of long time benefits that allowed a healthy work/life balance.New management does not appreciate employee benefits that this company was built on. Only the CFO seems to care and this is not a fun place to work as it used to be.

title: Just another company with little to no character
pros: Working at a nature sanctuary.
cons: The self awareness that management sits on your back while being forced to carry them. Executive management (when they speak) assures us that they're the appointed strategic leaders, serve nothing but the interest of Wall Street and wish to ease our concerns and uncertainty...except getting off our backs.

title: Great Place to Grow
pros: Great place to work if you love a challenge, want to grow, work hard, and make a difference. If you want to maintain the status quo or "coast," this is not the place for you. The many people that love it here are too busy to spend a lot of time posting on a public site. No organization is perfect. There is always room for improvement. Rather than complain on a public site, speak up and use your time and energy to make change happen from inside the organization.
cons: I don't have any complaints.

title: Reasons To Work At Welltower
pros: Ability to work remotely from any location is enhanced by the excellent technology and software systems provided by Welltower. Superb lines of communication both interdepartmentally and between ALL levels of corporate structure. Genuine interest in employee health/wellness intrinsic in the corporate culture is manifested in frequent, company-wide events and rewards. Free, wide-ranging, venues of training, coursework, seminars and classes available to all employees. Sense of teamwork and togetherness seldom found in corporate entities. Fair pay and benefits.
cons: Personal Time Off (PTO) package is modest. Work load is cyclical and during peak times very long hours are required to accomplish all work in given timeframes.

title: SCARY Times - KEEP Your head down
pros: It's a job in a shrinking Toledo market.
cons: EVERYTHING. Lies are told to employees daily. Over the last two years there seems to be a weekly ritual of firing people. People are scared to come to work. They encourage fraudulent reporting via threats of termination. Management claims to have a Whistleblower / Hotline but all issues go right to Management. Who would use it??? We take useless surveys that are nothing more than another tool for Management to isolate who to fire next. The rich continue to get richer and the workers are told to work harder and longer. Yeah, this is a great environment....Keep telling yourselves that.....

title: Get Real - It's not ALL about you
pros: Improving earnings and creating shareholder value are why people are employed by publicly traded companies in the first place. Historically, this was never management’s view and the company over hired and overpaid people to do average work. The new management team is cleaning up the company and positioning it for the future which has tremendous upside in a high growth sector. Work hard, be accountable, be transparent and you'll be rewarded.
cons: Tough times culturally during the transition, but the company has to evolve.

title: Phenomenal Experience
pros: I’ve found my work experience at Welltower thus far to be phenomenal in terms of professionalism, collaboration, and trust. I have felt such a strong satisfaction in my role and responsibilities. I’m not going to dis-credit the previous posts because I wasn’t in the same position or time and place as those that left them, but I do feel that the company is a *much* different company than it was half a decade ago in my assessment. Several previous complaints I see regarding compensation and benefits have been corrected. Welltower is a professional environment where I have been encouraged to express ideas to improve workflow and to achieve goals. My daily duties are versatile and stimulate my desire to do a great job and not only perform well in my own role, but to create a healthy workplace where others can do so as well. HR does a great job with onboarding and getting new employees familiar with not only the structure of the company. They offer free, wide-ranging, venues of training, coursework, seminars and classes available to all employees. There are internal communication tools that make knowledge sharing extremely easy and they are utilized regularly. Sense of teamwork and togetherness seldom found in corporate entities. A key part of doing well is to being willing to learn, ask questions, and put in work to perform your job to the best of your abilities. My direct supervisor is the absolute best: incredibly supportive and responsive. I’ve learned a lot from them already and feel genuinely appreciated in my role. Anytime I’ve had a question I’ve felt comfortable reaching out and going to anyone for help and they would assist or direct me to the right person. There’s a great opportunity for cross functional collaboration. I love that there’s an atmosphere of excellence over perfection and there seems to be an approach of constructive conflict resolution. I’ve previously worked in very cliquey atmosphere’s and Welltower is a complete opposite experience. I’ve seen several people from various backgrounds, degree levels, etc be in roles. Experience matters as well as who is best for the job, will perform the job well, and be a great fit. Because the structure at Welltower is pretty flat it allows for more cross-collaboration on projects, and development opportunities. You get to work across states with co-workers and managers in different locations – which allows for a lot of diversity of thought. I love working with others based out of Toledo, NY, FL, etc – and my co-workers have been collaborative and responsive. Benefits: Current postings are 100% accurate on benefits. • Competitive Base Salary + Annual Bonus • VERY Generous Paid Time Off and Holidays • Employer-matching 401(k) Program + Profit Sharing Program • Student Debt Program – monthly contribution to my student loans each month (up to $10,000 over life of the loan). • Tuition Assistance Program • Employee Stock Purchase Program – purchase shares at a 15% discount • Comprehensive and progressive Medical/Dental/Vision options • Package I selected is the BEST coverage I’ve ever had w/ low monthly premiums • Summer Hours Program • Flexible schedule w/options to work from home – excellent work/life balance • In office gym + gym/wellness reimbursements • Modern and contemporary beautiful office! • Great culture with friendly, open people & regular fun, interactive office events! • Snack + drink options to keep you fueled and productive throughout the day.
cons: Because the company is in the midst of rapid growth there are some natural challenges that come with that and can be difficult for some if you’re not accustomed to change, being flexible, and adjusting to changes in leadership and will have to be comfortable working across states with your co-workers and managers being in a different location. I think for most that our time in Covid has made us all able to adjust and handle this – and we’ve all become semi-experts on video meeting protocols! Also due to their being various offices and regions there could be a bit more consistency on how things are done in each region. There could be some increases in communication when changes come. This is always going to be challenging when you have a company this size, but I know it’s something looking to be improved. Obviously as a publicly traded company there is a financial obligation to increase earnings growth and serving shareholders, however in my opinion this isn’t done at the expense of the employees at all.

title: No work-life balance
pros: Solid company willing to invest, reward, and give opportunities to employees that demonstrate outstanding performance. Great benefits: PTO, Floating Holiday, Insurance, 401K, and an attractive annual bonus to those that add value to the company.
cons: Lack of direction and support from management mainly due to work overload. The quality of work is often affected. Quantity is what matters.

title: Questionable Ethics, Nice Campus
pros: Beautiful campus, nice cafe, decent perks, great compensation.
cons: Most of the unethical management, particularly in the HR group, have been released thankfully. Years of inappropriate relationships in that department are finally gone, however remnants of that regime still exist. The current top management, CEO and direct reports, (minus the CFO), are somehow managing to change the culture for the worse. Employee morale is at an all time low, which is shocking based on the previous regime's abusive behavior. Our last hope is that the BOD is able to replace the management team and make HCN great again.

title: Indeed Very Scary Times ....
pros: The gym and the office itself.
cons: Honestly, just too many to list. First and foremost, it's pretty sad that the company's propaganda machine is putting in their own reviews to slow down this avalanche of negative feedback on Glassdoor. It's pretty obvious HR is entering in these reviews. You knew what you were going to get and what was going to happen when you brought select people on board in 2016 that have a reputation for causing friction and angst among others. One of the senior leaders currently there has single-handedly destroyed what was once a great company culture and environment, and instead created one of extreme fear, politics, and backstabbing. As the saying goes, you reap what you sow. Deal with the fall out and consequences of your actions. In addition, to show you how vested these so called leaders are in the company and Toledo area itself, the CEO, along with many others, don't even live in Toledo. CEOs of all the major corporations in Toledo, live in Toledo, except for this company. New recruiters and new hires are being told to live in Ann Arbor instead of Toledo in order to get them to join the company. That's a complete shame and disservice to the city of Toledo. As many reviewers have correctly pointed out, there are cliques inside this company. If you're on the outside looking in, consider your career like drowning in quicksand and trying to stay afloat.

title: Confidence beats Competence
pros: Be prepared to have this company be your abusive boyfriend and keep you coming back for more because it's tough to find another place that's going to pay you what this place will in Toledo.
cons: The CEO and upper management are completely out of touch with the rest of the company. The CEO is a diva that cuts employee compensation to pay dividends to shareholders all the while traveling via private jet on an endless rock star tour and making no sacrifices of his own for the sake of the company. The morale in the office is one of so much fear of losing your job, trying to stay off the radar, and anxiety about when the other shoe is going to drop. No one is safe unless you know the right butt to kiss and even then you're still at risk of ending up on the CEO's henchman's infamous list of people on the chopping block. Politics aside, no one in upper management wants to take accountability and therefore the place is in a constant state of decision-making paralysis. This used to be a decent place to work with amazing employee perks but under the new regime it's just an abusive relationship and a paycheck. Oh and while they make budget cuts to employee compensation they send long-time, competent employees packing under the guise of "poor performance". Expect to see this place fail big time in the near future if they can't turn things around for employees. Over-confidence won't solve the problems they face that require competence.

title: Toledo ship sunk by Iceberg CEO
pros: For the employees that are still around to their paychecks, there is plenty of work to do. Due to the vehemently denied and therefore unofficial shift of HQ from Toledo to NY the office is less bourgeois and obnoxious.
cons: Very few of the employees that are left have the experience or knowledge to do what needs to be done to maintain a successful company. The CEO, having completed the turnover of the executive team and majority of upper management has surrounded himself with Yes Men. He has successfully annihilated any value and experience that existed on that team as well. Meanwhile, the core staff are being worked to the bone and are provided with zero guidance from leadership. No one is willing to take responsibility and lead. It's all about who can boast the loudest and make themselves look good whilst standing on the necks of the downtrodden remnants of what was once a talented workforce. Throwing money at vendors and consultants is the name of the game right now, in a poor attempt to fill in the gaps from the loss of quality employees due to lay offs and a toxic culture. No one in a position to fix the culture is willing to admit that there is even a problem, as that would force them to take a look in the mirror and admit that they aren't doing their job. Human Capital would rather spend time trying to get all of the excruciatingly honest Glassdoor reviews removed instead of actually doing something about the repeated complaints about culture and lack of leadership. Human Capital, the most overstaffed department at this lameduck company, is too busy patting themselves on the back, promoting themselves and feeding leadership and the board of directors poorly constructed stories that everything is just great, to even realize what is going on with the actual "human capital" inside the walls of the Toledo office. They don't even want to admit that HQ is actually in NY, when anyone with any experience in a corporate environment knows that HQ is where the majority of the executive team is based and for Welltower that is now NYC.

title: Dynamic, growing company with plenty of opportunity
pros: It is a fast-paced environment with good people that will challenge you. The senior housing and healthcare sectors have favorable demographics for the next 20 - 30 years and the industry is consolidating. Both factors contribute to a quickly growing company with many opportunities.
cons: Is is a fact-paced environment with good people that will challenge you.

title: Hostile Work Place
pros: A high ranking female and her HR counterpart made the HQ a very hostile workplace. If you are not white and on their side, life will be very difficult. The is a difference between how present and former Black employees are treated versus their white counterparts. Ask about exit interviews, it's sad that such a company has that uppity mentality versus blacks and non-ivy league employees.
cons: Not a positive work experience!!!

title: Cons outweigh the pros
pros: good benefits and friendly atmosphere
cons: outweigh the pros

title: Great insight into this lame duck company
pros: huge company so your benefits and pay are pretty good
cons: the company moral is bad. the way they treat their employees is horrible. not only on the facility management services side but also on the senior living side. they have a lot of buying power so they buyout a lot of companies, then treat you so bad so everyone will quit. I have met people on the senior living side that have been there almost 20 years and canned over small petty stuff with no write ups or anything. best advice for anyone - run from this company!

title: No leadership, hostile work environment, worst corporate culture ever
pros: Welltower is a good example of what a company should not be. It is everything that Peter Drucker warned business leaders against in his books on management and leadership.
cons: While there are too many mention, I will give the top three. 1. Leadership. General managers do nothing to resolve issues between the property management division and the project management division. Vice presidents do nothing to hold general managers accountable. Vice presidents and general managers refuse to talk to their employees. When people in key leadership positions leave the company, it is the responsibility of senior management to fill the voids with temps or to fill in those voids themselves. Instead, management waits indefinitely for a key position to be filled while the organization turns into a hostile work environment. Management does nothing to make sure that employees are properly trained before assuming their positions. Human resources does nothing to verify that managers have trained new employees. 2. Accountability. General contractors do as they please because there is no oversight by the project managers. Contractors leave the tenants irate and the buildings in worse condition, but are rewarded with more contracts. Welltower project mangers do not bother to read the contracts before signing and miss the fine print where the general contractor has stated that there is no warranty for the work being performed. When the contractor has finished with a project, he is given his last check and no punch walk or final punch walk is performed. It is clear that amateurs are at work. 3. No communication. Management deliberately withholds information from its employees. Because of management’s incompetence, it does not want any information to be divulged outside of its circle because the details are very embarrassing.

title: Turn around and don't look back
pros: For a support level role the pay is 58k, which to some is decent. Sometimes they buy lunch. (may have been covid-19 specific though)
cons: Worst environment ever, toxic, bad management, required after-hours for a helpdesk job. Yes it is helpdesk and only helpdesk with a 2-year commitment and then no room to grow because all high level work is outsourced (minus two people to communicate with vendors). Apply to software companies and stop letting corporations treat you like trash like this one. Please run and do not look back, accepting this position was the worst mistake of my life so far.

title: Poison in the Well (Part 2)
pros: Modern and contemporary office. Some decent perks, like discounts off monthly gym memberships, although many of these perks are slowly being whittled away due to cost reduction initiatives being implemented.
cons: A lot of information-holding and lack of knowledge sharing from others within the company, due to competitive nature of some employees and their desire to maintain an edge over others. Lack of collaboration in work culture and environment. It's not uncommon for a whole day to go by and not have anyone stop by your desk to ask a question or discuss something. You'll be inundated with countless emails or instant messages instead. Very old-school culture where flexibility is not viewed favorably. Also, hard work does not pay off, if you're not part of the right group that is laughing daily in the hallway and joking around. It's a very cliquey culture that reminds one of high school. Favouritism is clearly obvious by some people, especially by the newer employees. If you're not part of the crowd that lives in the bustling, cosmopolitan metropolis of Ann Arbor and commute to work in Toledo, you're at a disadvantage already in your career in the view of some. A lot of politics, especially with the new employees that have been there only a year or two. If an error is made, be prepared for a special task force to be assigned to figure out what happened and who should be roasted for it in front of everyone else. You don't know what's being said behind your back at any given point in time. Some of the new employees used to work on Wall Street, so be prepared to deal with those types of personalities, which can be unprofessional and very aggressive.

title: Great Company!
pros: Great company with very talented employees and leadership. Campus is beyond amazing. Perfectly positioned in a growing industry. Northwest Ohio is a nice friendly place to raise a family.
cons: Toledo has its rough spots but is growing. Many people live in the nice suburbs such as Slyvania, Maumee, and Perrysburg. Ann Arbor is not that far as well.

title: REIT review
pros: I enjoyed working at Health Care REIT (now known as Welltower). There was a great work / life balance, and business travel was held to a minimum.
cons: Company really mishandled closing of Brentwood office. Gave employees very little time to consider relocation offers and wanted a final answer during the Christmas season, with the last day of employment being New Years Eve.

title: Great company with a few bugs to work out
pros: Great benefits, a beautiful campus and very nice people make HCN a good place to work. They have also started wellness and women's initiative programs that are appreciated by employees.
cons: Fast growth has caused communication issues, silo-ed departments and inefficiencies in policies and protocol. Bureaucratic and hierarchical organizational structure makes change hard.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Work life Balance Health and Well Benefits Friendly atmosphere PTO and holiday time off Opportunity to be promoted Low turnover
cons: High volume/Fast paced Constant changes year over year

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Welltower has a very meritocratic structure. You will sink or swim based on your abilities.
cons: More senior employees tend to lead very busy and challenging lives. This can be overwhelming and off-putting. Why would you want to advance if the next rungs on the ladder are unattractive?

title: Tremendous Opportunity
pros: Challenging work, organization isn't afraid to make bold decisions, one of the most talented teams in Northwest Ohio, great campus
cons: Rapid growth has led to unstable environment at times which can be difficult for some, challenging work/life balance, leadership in transition

title: Fast-paced, Entrepreneurial culture, Competitive Pay/Benefits
pros: Industry leader with an incredible amount of runway. Small company feel but with the financials and stability of a major multinational organization. Very supportive of personal and professional development. Good benefits with a lot of progressive offerings.
cons: None to share at this time.

title: Plenty of positives
pros: Smart, hard-working, motivated, high quality people; vision for how real estate and partnerships can improve healthcare; interesting work
cons: Some departments are spread thin

title: Welltower
pros: Welltower is ahead of the pack when it comes to addressing social issues as well as employee benefits/appreciation. They do a great job at rewarding employees for hard work.
cons: I can not think of any at the moment.

title: Take off the rose colored glasses. It's not going to get better.
pros: The only good thing at Welltower were some of the people.
cons: When are people going to wake up? Anyone not searching for a new job at this point better hurry before it's too late. Upper management could care less about YOU.

title: security / Transportation supervisor
pros: Great building great grounds most employees excellent to work with
cons: Low pay bad supervision no teamwork Dog Eat Dog company y

title: Real Estate Specialist
pros: Take time to teach the structure of the business.
cons: Lack of senior leadership and direction.

title: Great Benefits- job satisfaction highly dependent upon your manager
pros: benefits that employees care about - 401k match, student loan repayment assistance, great maternity leave benefit, generous PTO
cons: lack of upward mobility in certain job roles

title: Face paced company, flat structure and lots of talent.
pros: Competitive salary, flexible location, incredible team, flat structure.
cons: Seniors housing is a tough business these days due to the COVID pandemic.

title: Great Company
pros: Great Benefits. Excellent Company Culture. Great Training.
cons: I did not experience any

title: One of the best cultures around
pros: Great company culture, fair compensation, stable organization
cons: Advancement opportunities are limited due to low turnover.

title: Awesome Managers and Peers
pros: The managers at all levels ask for ideas from all levels.
cons: Wages are lower then other property management companies for similar positions as seem on Glassdoor.

title: Fairness of pay
pros: benefits - value health and encourages that kind of environment
cons: micro managing trust people will make mistakes but grow from them.

title: Good Company
pros: Everyone is so nice and inviting. People are always willing to help out. No micromanaging in my dept.
cons: I haven’t found any yet.

title: Underpaid but good experience

pros: Great company; great benefits. Willing to invest in its employees

title: Wonderful company
pros: Learn so much. Amazing people and company mission. Team work and collaboration is extremely encouraged.
cons: No cons to report at this time!

title: Would work there again and again
pros: Collaborative, inviting environment. Great group of people to work with across all offices.
cons: Cannot think of any negatives.

title: Great company, values their employees.
pros: Good structure, invests in employees
cons: HR is a one person show, hard to resolve issues.

title: Still a good company
pros: Good pay and benefits, great product.
cons: Leadership is fearful and insecure

title: Property manager
pros: Good secure company. Cares about employees.
cons: Pay could be a bit higher.

title: Great Company
pros: Focused on providing employees the tools they need to succeed
cons: None to speak of at the moment.

Great managers
Willing to help you grow

title: Great Company

title: Facilities

title: Poorly Managed
pros: Great campus and cafeteria. Enjoyed some of the people.

title: Great Company
pros: The atmosphere, opportunity for growth, and the people.
cons: Working Demand, hours and training.

title: Annonymous
pros: Nice building and outside grounds

title: Analyst
pros: Good Company but transition is a tough environment to work in
cons: Transition is tough environment to work in

title: Excellent company with great upside
pros: It has a professional atmosphere with emphasis on results, but is also laid back enough to enjoy. The new building is amazing, and its fun to work in such an environment. The company itself is resting on very sound economics.
cons: Toledo itself is not the greatest city in the world. If you are not from Toledo it can be hard to get used to.

title: Great place to grow
pros: Very collaborative environment that allows you to grow and take on new challenges.

title: Good job
